page.title: 10Farming:Making Cornish Cream
page.content: My mum gets up at 7o'clock in the morning and gets the cows in from the field. She has 1 Jersey, 1 Friesian and 8 Geurnseys. She milks by machine, although she used to milk by hand. When she has finished milking all ten cows she strains the milk into a churn to get any tiny bits of dirt out and then takes the churns to the separating house, where she separates the cream from the milk. The creamy milk goes into bowls to be scalded and the skim milk is fed to the pigs. Once the cream has cooked and has a nice crust on it, she puts it into cartons ready for taking to the shop next day.
